title: What was the greatest year, decade, or century in the history of music? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer really depends on how you’re looking at the evolution of music, and then what sort of genre you’re into. I mean Baroque and what we now consider Classical music is probably the most important step towards moving music out of just the very elite salons and into public performance spaces (yes it was still expensive and mostly elite, but it made that first step). After that it’s a matter of taste - depending on what sort of music you like, there’s so many important events and milestones - but they’re all different. But personally, I think a lot of the modern changes that made a huge impact came about in the 60’s and 70’s - with people like Elvis making music into a global sensation, and Queen (popularising dancing on stage AND creating the first music PV rather than just a live recording).

The greatest few decades, from 1800 to 1840. That’d be the 19th century. But since I don’t like some of the changes that happened during the second half, I won’t vote the entire century. The 1800/1840 period includes Beethoven’s 5th, 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Symphonies, Berlioz’ Symphonie Fantastique, Harold in Italy, Les Nuits d’Ete and Requiem, and Schubert’s entire life! Oh, the envy…
